Thanks!
That was a very helpful and thorough response.  It appears that I'm=

screwing something up in matlab so I'll be looking over that code to
find =
my errors.

Aleks
--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Philip Tucker" <ptucker@...=
> wrote:
>
> Hi Aleks,
> 
> Welcome to the group!  That looks an awful lot =
like ANJI output, so I'm
> going to assume that's the implementation you're=
 using.  I'm one of the
> developers of ANJI.
> 
> What you have here is tw=
o different runs that solved XOR.  One took 77
> generations, the other too=
k 49 generations (if memory serves, it's
actually
> 78 and 50, since genera=
tion number is 0-based).  I'll give a
line-by-line
> summary of the first o=
ne.
> 
> INFO  Generation 77: start
> 
> 
> Beginning of generation 77.  Ev=
erything between here and "Generation
77: end
> [start-stop] [duration]" is=
 logged for every generation.
> 
> INFO  connection->neuron id map size =3D=
=3D 55
> > INFO  neurons->connection id map size =3D=3D 394
> 
> 
> These m=
aps are data structures that track the innovation IDs of
neuron and
> conne=
ction genes.  Basically, this means the population contains 55
> connection=
 genes and 394 neuron genes.  Note that the same gene can
exist in
> multip=
le chromosomes.
> 
> INFO  species count: 32
> 
> 
> # species in the popul=
ation this generation.
> 
> INFO  max: id=3D9786 score=3D1.0 size=3D25
> 
>=
 INFO  # chromosomes with max fitness: 1
> 
> INFO  champ: id=3D9786 score=
=3D1.0 size=3D25
> 
> 
>  Sometimes you will have multiple chromosomes in o=
ne generation with max
> fitness.  In that case, you'd have multiple "max" =
lines.  In this case
> there's only one, so the first and third lines are r=
edundant.  The
champ's
> ID is 9786.  Its score is 1.0.  It contains 25 gen=
es.
> 
> INFO  Generation 77: end [23:31:42 - 23:31:43] [1
> 
> 
> End of g=
eneration 77.  Since this is the final generation, the rest
of the
> log li=
nes are a summary of the entire run.  The first set of brackets
> indicate =
start and end time.  The second set of brackets indicate
duration
> in mill=
iseconds.
> 
> INFO  generation of first solution =3D=3D 34
> 
> 
> ANJI pr=
ovides two fitness paramaters, threshold and target.  Threshold
> indicates=
 the lowest fitness that can be considered a candidate
solution.
> But you =
might want the run to continue to find a better solution. 
Target
> indicat=
es a fitness that is sufficient for the run to stop.  I don't
recall
> the =
values for the example, but let's say threshold=3D0.8 and target=3D1.0.
> T=
his line indicates the first chromosome to exceed 0.8 occurred in
> generat=
ion 34.  But it took until generation 77 to get a fitness of 1.0.
> 
> INFO=
  champ # connections =3D=3D 15
> > INFO  champ # hidden nodes =3D=3D 6
> 
=
> 
> # connections and hidden nodes in overall champion for the entire run.=

> Adding the 3 inputs and 1 output neuron to these yields 15+6+3+1=3D25,
w=
hich
> is the number of genes mentioned above.
> 
> INFO  Run: end [23:29:5=
9 - 23:31:44] [104531]
> 
> 
> End of the run.  Start/end time and duration=
 are the same as the
> "Generation: end" log line.
> 
> I hope that helps.
=
> 
> - Philip
>
